triplets: Reading material consisting of bound pages containing written, printed, or illustrated content
Reading, gaining knowledge, storytelling, education, research, and entertainment
Paper for pages, cardboard or paperboard for cover; ink for text and illustrations; sometimes fabric or leather for binding
Pages containing written or printed content
Cover providing protection and support for pages, may include front, back, and spine
Varies depending on cover design, printing, and publisher; pages are typically white or cream
Libraries, schools, personal collections, bookstores, and educational institutions
Various publishers, printing companies, and authors
Approximately 0.1–2 kg depending on size, page count, and material quality
Typically 20–30 cm depending on book format and publisher
Typically 5–50 years depending on paper quality, usage, storage, and care
